result.execSummary:
The defendant Cameron S Bates was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on February 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

$500 per count
  CASH BAIL TO REVERT TO SIGNATURE BOND AT 10:00AM ON MONDAY, JANUARY 13, 2014 AND THE DEFENDANT MUST REPORT DIRECTLY TO THE BAIL MONITORING PROGRAM.
- The court orders a signature bond in the amount of $500.00 per count on the condition that the defendant reports to, and complies with, Dane County Bail Monitoring (DCBM).  The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.  If the defendant fails to comply with Dane County Bail Monitoring. Cash bail is automatically set in the amount of $1,500.00 per count, as higher cash bail is necessary to assure appearance in court. If Defendant posts this higher amount of bail and is released from jail, the Sheriff is directed to notify DCBM. If Defendant is out of custody, supervision by DCBM is required to enforce conditions of release and protect the public.The Defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. Defendant is ordered to cooperate with DCBM.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Paige M or any residence that is occupied by Paige M
- Defendant shall not possess any type of dangerous weapon.
  Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 1

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Status conference scheduled for February 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
